DOC.brief_summary: The study will compare how often the tubing kinks when a LMA (laryngeal mask airway) with modified retractor is used compared to use of an endotracheal tube (ETT) and non modified retractor is used.
DOC.brief_title: Laryngeal Mask Airway in Pediatric Adenotonsillectomy
DOC.detailed_description: The laryngeal mask airway (LMA)is a device used to secure the airway of patients during general anesthesia. This device is routinely used for anesthesia in elective head and neck surgeries, including adenotonsillectomy. In this study, the efficacy of the LMA will be studied as it pertains to operative times and cost. The child will be randomized into either the LMA group or the ETT group.
DOC.criteria: requiring adenotonsillectomy for Obstructive sleep apnea or chronic tonsillitis between the ages of 216 children with BMI >35 unwillingness to comply with study procedures children with craniofacial anomalies/abnormalities which will interfere with mask placement children under 2 or over 16
